summary: Email chain from July 2-3, 2020 regarding the custody arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack County Department of Corrections. The correspondence involves requests to add her New York attorneys to her approved contact list and outlines strict security protocols for her detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the custody arrangements and security protocols at Merrimack County DOC. She is a high-profile inmate with restricted communication privileges.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender is requesting be added to her approved contact list for phone calls.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender is requesting be added to her approved contact list for phone calls.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney already on Ghislaine Maxwell's approved contact list. Communication with him is authorized only after he provides the appropriate PIN.

persons.name: Gene
persons.context: Mentioned as being 'on it' regarding the request to add attorneys to Maxwell's contact list.

connections.description: Everdell is one of Maxwell's New York defense attorneys. The email chain seeks to add him to her approved contact list for phone calls.
Cohen is one of Maxwell's New York defense attorneys. The email chain seeks to add him to her approved contact list for phone calls.
Vogelman is already on Maxwell's approved attorney contact list, with communication requiring a PIN.
Both are partners at the same law firm, Cohen & Gresser LLP, and are co-counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Custody Directives Issued for Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service issues strict custody and security directives for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack County DOC, including housing in medical, SRT guards, 15-minute observation, and restricted communication.

events.title: Request to Add Attorneys to Contact List
events.description: Email correspondence requesting that Maxwell's New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, be added to her approved phone contact list to facilitate case discussions.

locations: Merrimack County Department of Corrections (Merrimack DOC)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at Merrimack County DOC under extremely high-security protocols as of July 2020.
Her communication was restricted to only her legal counsel, initially just Lawrence Vogelman, with requests to add her New York attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
Security measures included housing in a medical cell, a dedicated SRT guard, 15-minute observation watches, and a ban on staff conversation with her outside health and safety needs.
The email chain shows coordination between legal representatives and custodial authorities (likely USMS) to manage her attorney access.
The document reflects the high-profile, sensitive nature of her detention, with explicit instructions against staff speaking to the press.
